column2: With the advent of the Watergate scandal and Nixon's spying on the NPP, John F. Kennedy has stepped up from the office of Vice-President to assure the public and lead the country out of these uncertain times.

The nation is in mourning today as President John F. Kenendy was assasinated in Dallas during a public parade. The assailant is yet to be captured and speculation on the motive of the shooting has raged wildly from a militant reaction to the American interventionism in Guyana or even possibly to J.F.K.'s support of the civil rights act.

The overwhelming perception of the Malta Conference among Italian Politics is that of utter failure. The lack of proper resolution and the acquiescence of demands to the former Triumvirate members has lead many in the government to doubt the leadership of Il Duce Galeazzo Ciano and to call for a conference in Verona to debate the future of the Italian Empire.
The tension in Verona is intense as Il Duce Ciano has to contend with not only his §Rhardliner opponents in the National Fascist Party who have organized themselves into a political faction dubbing themselves the "Quadrumvirate"§!, but also the §Bdemocratic reformist ideals of the Italian monarch King Umberto II §!who has found himself much support in the armed forces and the more pragmatic members of the party. Meanwhile, in the shadows of the conference the Red Brigade organization awaits with baited breath an opportune moment to strike and coup the whole government for their goal of Italian socialist freedom.



§BTo be more specific: §GIl Duce Ciano must carefully balance the demands of the King and the Quadrumvirate if you want to maintain the current government and party. §RHowever, making too many concessions to one side may bring an end to Italian Fascism!§!
There will be three rounds of negotiations during the conference.

The Verona Conference continues as debate rages over voting rights.\nKing Umberto II wants an expansion of voting rights to more of the public, and the support he has gathered makes overruling such an action impossible without the support of the Quadrumvirate, who have personal political demands themselves.

The Verona Conference continues as debate rages over congressional appointments.\nKing Umberto II wants party deputies and ministers to be directly elected by the public, and the support he has gathered makes overruling such an action impossible without the support of the Quadrumvirate, who have personal political demands themselves.

The Verona Conference continues as debate rages over party rights.\nKing Umberto II wants an easement on the political suppression of groups outside of the National Fascist Party, and the support he has gathered makes overruling such an action impossible without the support of the Quadrumvirate, who have personal political demands themselves.

Il Duce Ciano is no more. With his continued reliance on the Quadrumvirate to oppose reforms presented by Umberto II, Ciano has passed a sufficient amount of political power over to them to allow them to dipose him with a vote of no confidence in the National Fascist Congress. Fully in control of the nation the Quadrumvirate now aims to fully enforce Mussolini's core tenets once more.

Calm has passed over Verona as many of the National Fascist Party hardliners have been appeased by Il Duce's calm and expert political manoeuvering, evaporating the Quadrumvirate's party support. With King Umberto II pleased with the moderate reforms it seems as if all opposition to Il Duce's conservative rule has been pacified.

A stunning display has occured in Verona as many leading figures in the National Fascist Party, including Il Duce Ciano himself, have been arrested by the King Umberto II and his supporters in the armed forces. Umberto II, emboldened by his success in the Verona conference, has announced the restoration of popular voting and the traditional Italian monarchy.

A stunning display has occured in Verona as many leading figures in the National Fascist Party, including Il Duce Ciano himself, have been killed in an act perpetrated by the Italian Red Brigade organization. The King Umberto II has been whisked away to safety abroad by his supporters in the armed forces, leaving a power vacuum open in the paralyzed government for the Italian Red Brigade organization to sieze in short fashion. The socialist organization which has been fighting in secret since the Second World War has declared themselves the vanguard party of the new Italian state and has announced popular elections for the recently organized central committee.
